urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@The_Skill_Mill @SkillMill_Notts @stwater @MyNottingham @NottinghamFPA @ssemidlands @NottmCastle @Notts_VRU @VisitNotts @exceptionals_uk @EnvAgencyMids Amazing! Thanks so much for getting stuck in and braving the üåß
RT @PeterReavill: @TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Here‚Ä¶

text: @TeuchterNature @EnvAgency We had a section of river here with water vole iron revetted, EA involved, police wildlife officer claimed he was taking action but did nothing, what is good is majority local opinion was extreme anger, the new resident has not had a friendly start to village life
